references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of large language models and their ability to perform well on few-shot learning tasks, which is highly relevant to reasoning models.

references.paper_title: Physics of Language Models: Part 3.3, Knowledge Capacity Scaling Laws
references.reason: This paper explores the scaling laws of language models which is directly relevant to understanding the capacity and limitations of reasoning models.

references.paper_title: Training Verifiers to Solve Math Word Problems
references.reason: This paper introduces GSM8K, a benchmark dataset used in the evaluation of Typhoon T1, demonstrating its importance in evaluating mathematical reasoning capabilities.

references.paper_title: DeepSeek-R1: Incentivizing Reasoning Capability in LLMs via Reinforcement Learning
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel approach for developing reasoning models through reinforcement learning, providing a relevant alternative to supervised fine-tuning.
This paper introduces Typhoon 2, the base model used in the development of Typhoon T1, highlighting its significance as the foundation of the Thai reasoning model.
